{% endraw %}

Install

PS, not working yet. Use git clone

pip install doc_collection

How to use

Firstly, you need to pip list of packages to be able to collect data from it:

{% raw %} 
pip_top_hundred()
{% endraw %}

Now you are ready to extract data from all libs you've pipped and it's dependencies:

{% raw %} 
extract()
{% endraw %}

Command above will return DataFrame of three columns: text contains documentation of an object, paths contains all names of an object (can be more than one) and library contains library of an object.

Elasticsearch

!!! 8.3.2 version of elastic was used

To create index and load mentioned dataframe to elastic.

{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

The index's name is doc and other fields are the same as in dataframe.
